title: Thomas Pellegrino
author: Thomas Pellegrino
content: Bitcoin truly is a gift to the world but it could have helped so many more people. It's a shame that it only truly benefits a small portion of the global population. It could've changed the world on a comprehensive societal and economic level.Any thoughts?

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Thomas Pellegrino on November 20, 2024, 05:06:10 AMBitcoin truly is a gift to the world but it could have helped so many more people. It's a shame that it only truly benefits a small portion of the global population. It could've changed the world on a comprehensive societal and economic level.Any thoughts?Gold, silver, and other precious stones are free gifts of nature, but only a few people own them. Bitcoin cannot be owned by everybody because a large portion of the global population doesn't even know what Bitcoin is. Some people still believe that it is a scam and will gradually become worthless. While others are limited by illiteracy, lack of basic infrastructures like internet connections, and poverty. The distribution of global wealth is not done in an equitable manner. "The richest 1% own almost half of the world’s wealth, while the poorest half of the world own just 0.75%".

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: If Bitcoin helped the global population, it means Bitcoin will not be as valuable as now and it might be worthless because these poor people don't even need to spend money to get Bitcoin. What's the point to have 0.002625 BTC if 1 Bitcoin worth for $1.Although I do get benefit by investing in Bitcoin, but if I didn't participate in signature campaign and have a job, I will not able to have Bitcoin.

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: Do you mean Bitcoin as an appreciating asset or as a decentralized asset.Not as how it changed lives of early adopters but its still making waves and impacts in the lives of more people. The changes it could bring us granting Financial freedom and a means to resist inflation Not creating wealthy individuals or society That's more like an add on.

comments.author: BD User
comments.body: Bitcoin needs to be made accessible to reach all kinds of people around the world. Bitcoin will continue to lose its value if it becomes more accessible. Bitcoin is so successful because it is not easy for everyone. As you have planned, Bitcoin will need to increase the supply of Bitcoin in order for it to benefit the majority of people worldwide. If this happened Bitcoin would not be where it is today.Majority of people worldwide can definitely access Bitcoin, but most people's thinking is not positive for Bitcoin. They think Bitcoin is a scam. People who are Bitcoin positive are benefiting from Bitcoin today. People are not able to benefit from Bitcoin because of their own mindset. It will certainly be a reason for happiness for Bitcoin and Bitcoiners if the majority of people in the world get into Bitcoin.

comments.author: Charles-Tim

It's a shame that it only truly benefits a small portion of the global population. It could've changed the world on a comprehensive societal and economic level.If you have $1 billion today and everybody in the world have $1 billion. That means you are not rich because you have what everybody are having which makes it not scarce. You will find it difficult to see someone to employ and it would be as if people do not have money at all. Let nature be what it should be for people to know its value.Also bitcoin helped those that bought it. That is certain. Although, it helped beyond because if not because of bitcoin, no exchanges and other crypto businesses will be existing today which employ people and getting paid.

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: Quote from: Thomas Pellegrino on November 20, 2024, 05:06:10 AMBitcoin truly is a gift to the world but it could have helped so many more people. It's a shame that it only truly benefits a small portion of the global population. It could've changed the world on a comprehensive societal and economic level.Any thoughts?Can you explain how Bitcoin could've helped all the people around the world? By buying low and selling high? Do you really understand how the markets work? A financial market cannot work if all traders make profit and nobody makes loses. Imagine all the people around the world having Bitcoin. The BTC price would hit absurd levels, but the price growth would most likely be over. Who is going to make profits, when the Bitcoin price stops growing? Only the "bears". The people, who sell at a higher price and buy later at a lower price.How do you imagine Bitcoin changing the economy and the society, when the blockchain can't handle an unlimited amount of transactions?

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Of course, only those that have the believe in bitcoin will invest in bitcoin and benefit from it, because bitcoin is not free and nobody will force  you to invest in bitcoin if you don't want. Some people have the awareness but they don't like it because they feel it's not real. While some that would have loved to invest, don't have the funds or awareness about it. When bitcoin was as cheap as $1, people ignored it and many people will continue to ignore bitcoin because they don't know it's a new form of wealth.

It's a shame that it only truly benefits a small portion of the global population. It could've changed the world on a comprehensive societal and economic level.Any thoughts?How is it a shame? Is there anything apart from life that people have equal distribution of? It's natural to have unequal distribution of wealth and anything you can think of. Bitcoin is following the same path despite there's enough available. Is there any resources that benefits the entire global population without working for it? Your hardwork will earned you the portion that you deserve. Normally, we already understand that wealth attract wealth and people with materials getting a larger benefit. It's a result of their hardworking and nothing more.

It's a shame that it only truly benefits a small portion of the global population. However, with proper research and patience, those who made long efforts in studying bitcoin will discover its high potentials and eventually decide to invest on it, while those who have always been doubtful and hesitant, they will never experience the vast benefits from bitcoin.

comments.author: jcojci
comments.body: Bitcoin is a gift to all people but unfortunately, only a small portion of the global population that use Bitcoin. But in the future, the number of people who use Bitcoin will increase following of the popularity of Bitcoin that also rise. But that will only if they want to open their minds about the existence of Bitcoin and willing to learn more about Bitcoin. We know that some people out there saying Bitcoin is a scam and that is because they don't know how Bitcoin work and not know how people can make money from Bitcoin. If they know for sure and see the reality, they will want to join with them and trying to buy as many Bitcoin as they can and hold it for a long term.

comments.author: Smack That Ace
comments.body: Quote from: Helena Yu on November 20, 2024, 06:00:05 AMAlthough I do get benefit by investing in Bitcoin, but if I didn't participate in signature campaign and have a job, I will not able to have Bitcoin.Bitcoin is not free, we need to work hard, need money to own bitcoin so we cannot say that bitcoin is helping or benefiting society. To be precise, we are saving ourselves and bitcoin is one of the tools we use. Bitcoin is a financial market, and when investing there will be winners and losers, no market makes everyone win. So bitcoin will be seen as a savior for those who know how to use it to make profits but on the contrary, those who lose money will not be able to say that bitcoin is helping them.

comments.author: asriloni
comments.body: Bitcoin was new tech a decade ago, and not many people were open-mined to adopt it. Some even called it as a scam, a ponzi, etc. So, how can you say it could have helped more people when they were anti-Bitcoin? And this time you're blaming a small population who are open-minded to Bitcoin, and adopted it as a new tech. It doesn't even make sense to see you said that like Bitcoin was not for everyone. I remind you of the people themselves who could change their economic status, and it's not bitcoin.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: franky1 on November 20, 2024, 08:25:18 AMto clarify and correct a few points of some posts in this topicbitcoin is not actually coded/ruled as '21m btc'.. at the data and rule layer of the protocol everything is actually measured in satoshis. there will be 2,099,999,997,690,000 unitsBitcoin and its controlled supply.How is the 21 million bitcoin cap defined and enforcedSome documents to read for OP to understand about Bitcoin supply.Quotethat can be split upmeaning 8mill population could have +/- ~262500 eachobviously no one in the world is going to have equal share but there are enough sats that everyone can have someBitcoin exists for everyone who can work for bitcoin or can have money to invest in bitcoin, to get satoshi, fraction of bitcoin or bitcoins. It's up to each person to get bitcoin because times for Bitcoin faucets like 5 BTC for one claim from Gavin Andresen's faucet no longer exists in 2024.Now, if they want to have bitcoin, work for bitcoin, receive salary directly in bitcoin, or work for cash, for altcoins, and convert it to bitcoin.Bitcoin Equivalent Network Time is an interesting topic that can enlighten OP about power and advantage of joining Bitcoin market earlier than other people who will join in coming years and upcoming market cycles.

If there are those who have made money on Bitcoin price growth (I suppose this is what you call as help), it means that there are those who have lost those money. People talk about help only when price goes up. But think about other side of the coin.

Or maybe he should have created a bitcoin wallet for a lot of people and send in bitcoin to them. Anyone that wants to benefit from Bitcoin can still invest and hold till the price give a new ATH.

comments.author: Alone055
comments.body: Quote from: Thomas Pellegrino on November 20, 2024, 05:06:10 AMBitcoin truly is a gift to the worldTrue.Quote from: Thomas Pellegrino on November 20, 2024, 05:06:10 AMbut it could have helped so many more people.How exactly? We were hoping you could explain that so that we can discuss it with you.Quote from: Thomas Pellegrino on November 20, 2024, 05:06:10 AMIt's a shame that it only truly benefits a small portion of the global population. It could've changed the world on a comprehensive societal and economic level.Why is it a shame for a small portion of the global population to benefit from something they can acquire and use in the best way possible?It's a wrong ideology to think that Bitcoin can or could help the masses gain financial freedom or get out of their financial or economic problems because Bitcoin is a form of money. I don't understand how one can have another form of money to benefit from when they don't have money in the first place. The small portion of the global population that benefits from Bitcoin is the ones who can afford to buy it, or they are somehow able to earn it by using their skills and abilities.You can't expect people having no money, resources, or skills to benefit from Bitcoin or cryptocurrencies because it's not possible.
